abstract: America’s biggest banks are recovering at the expense of smaller institutions; Bank of America’s shareholders are accepting postponed benefits.
snippet: America’s biggest banks are recovering at the expense of smaller institutions; Bank of America’s shareholders are accepting postponed benefits.
lead_paragraph: To hear the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation tell it, the banking industry is returning to fine fettle. The number of institutions on the agency’s problem list fell for the first time in nearly five years. Bank failures are down. Loan books even grew slightly. So the crisis in America’s financial system is officially coming to an end.

headline.main: The Hazards of Success in American Banking
headline.print_headline: Big Banks’ Success Can Be a Hazard

byline.original: By ROB COX and ANTONY CURRIE
